intro: Pavetta bousigoniana, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a reddish or purple underside.
